alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL...NORTHWESTERN HARDING AND SOUTHEASTERN MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM MDT... At 609 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wagon Mound to 13 miles southwest of Trujillo. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Wagon Mound, Variadero, Maes, Trujillo, and Trementina. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 381 and 394. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 21 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Northeast Highlands
